beer.beer_description: We’re going a little darker, a little cheekier, and bringing a German classic to Bathurst with our take on an Altbier. Born in Düsseldorf but raised in Bathurst, this dark ale is smooth, malty and just a touch nutty. It’s got a toasty caramel backbone, balanced bitterness and a crisp finish that’ll keep you coming back for “just one more” Let’s show Oktoberfest how we get Reckless.

We’re going a little darker, a little cheekier, and bringing a German classic to Bathurst with our take on an Altbier. Born in Düsseldorf but raised in Bathurst, this dark ale is smooth, malty and just a touch nutty. It’s got a toasty caramel backbone, balanced bitterness and a crisp finish that’ll keep you coming back for “just one more” Let’s show Oktoberfest how we get Reckless.

While spontaneity can be fun, sometimes you want to make sure your adventure will rock. Checkout the menu at an Untappd Verified Venue before visiting and know exactly what’s on tap! That's 360 check-ins at venue that is verified.  Try 5 more for Level 73!

Originating from Germany, the Altbier, or old beer, uses the old school brewing style of top fermentation and is left to condition for longer than normal. That's 5 different beers with the style of Altbier. Try 5 for more Level 2!

items.checkin_comment: Malty and biscuity with a mashing of caramel. Sweet and frothy.

items.checkin_comment: Beer cartel #11. German again, this is another great altbier. Classic malty and spicy hop combo. Perfect way to wash down way too much food after Christmas lunch with the family.

Instagram: @Matttteachingbeernerd
Twitter:@MatthewBeggs
A Bloke from the Bush.
Alone in quiet places with a bottle and a song
Embracing mediocrity.
I love beer. My aim is to taste and review as many different beer from around the world. 1 beer at a time.
